I hadn't seen one of these around yet so I thought I would make my own. There are obviously inaccuracies so I wouldn't exactly call it a replica but it looks very similar and is really fun to fly as well as being useful. 

**Mk3 Skylon SSTO**

![eoPIalb.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/eoPIalb.jpg)

![012VI5t.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/012VI5t.jpg)

The craft is very versatile. There is a lot of room for extra fuel if you need more DeltaV, (Mun and Minmus orbital missions). It is easy to move fuel around to balance the plane with different payloads but honestly it doesn't seem to need it as the cargo bays are so close to the centre of gravity.

![atJ4Rug.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/atJ4Rug.jpg)

It comes with a sample payload, a medium sized fuel station. (Hotkey 0 to deploy solar panels). You will need to use the whole runway to fly with this but once she is airborne she handles very well.

![8KdjJ77.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/8KdjJ77.jpg)

![yD1mrYt.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/yD1mrYt.jpg)

The craft glides very well when coming into land and survives re-entry without flipping out provided you don't perform any sudden manoeuvres. There's plenty of fuel if you want to land with jet engines.

![8qwGhGc.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/8qwGhGc.jpg)

![RYGCNSh.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/RYGCNSh.jpg)

![pdZ53yi.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/pdZ53yi.jpg)

![VASDxFQ.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/VASDxFQ.jpg)

With sample payload - 374 parts - 150.7 tons

Without sample payload = 348 parts - 119.1 tons

I had to use a lot of struts and bracing to ensure the thrust of the engines didn't rip the wings off.

**Hotkey 2** = Toggle bay doors

It is an impressive build, don't get me wrong... but I concur that probably Mk2 Skylons still have their place. After all, even with that many hidden wings, I'd bet you this flies more because of "everything will fly if you put enough boosters on it" than because such a thing could fly. RL's Sklylon's fuel tanks are incredibly low-density, considering they mostly carry hydrogen. And still it would take off at about 300km/h.

Also, my Skylon is the first time I did a "all tanks feed at the same rate" trick. And without clipping! So there's that. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Rune. Plus, it managed a respectable 25% of GLOW as payload with two intakes per engine.
It looks like a skylon that is for sure. Nice build. Cargo fraction isnt really that high tho and you could have used even 2 largest cargo holds.

I could have increased the cargo space for sure but I wanted it reasonably accurate to the real one, (well, the one that doesn't yet exist, lol), however I will probably remake this when 1.0 comes out and I might make a version with a larger bay. I just don't want to make it hard to get into orbit, (this one is currently very easy), keep it noob friendly.
